COMMENT: No earwig has any relation to ears whatsoever. It is not even a legend, but just a folk-etymological analysis of this word, which must have been a compound like *ousVwik- (further *ousVwert- etc. - cf. Slav. *uxo-vьrt-) with a substitution of the 2d part by a productive root). The present root must have been the second part of the compound (*wīk-, denoting a tapeworm in Baltic), but the first part is unclear.
